channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023070050
item.description:
Report E-2023070050

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 1700 pound battery(un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070037
item.description:
Report E-2023070037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading the contents of the tank car into a cargo tank truck using a portable pump, the bolt that retracts a self closing valve sheered, causing the valve to open slightly, and allowing liquid through the valve. The cap at the end of the pressure relief valve was not properly seated, so liquid bypassed the cap and released onto the ground. Veolia personnel closed the valve to stop the release and conducted spill cleanup in-house.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Item was discovered in front of delivery van in garbage bag with note stating damaged hazmat DescribePack: Glass item was broken inside packaging DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was picked up by QA, placed in leak proof hazmat plastic bag, placed in damaged hazmat tote, and brought to QA for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023061596
item.description:
Report X-2023061596

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully Regulated package came to QA soiled due to one of the caps on the NON REGULATED part B bottles coming loose and allowing liquid to leak. The CORROSIVE part A bottles were both undamaged. DescribePack: A loose cap on the bottle allowed liquid to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in tote and brought to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023061540
item.description:
Report X-2023061540

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered with bottom flaps open, wet, showing signs of internal leakage. Package has strong chemical smell. Found 1-4L glass bottle leaked appx 20floz due to loose cap. Bottle inside plastic bag, spill mostly contained but still leaked some outside the bag as well. DescribePack: Leaked due to loose cap. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Closed cap as tightly as possible without removing plastic outer bag. Package contained in hazbag in red haz tote awaiting disposition

item.title: Report X-2023061526
item.description:
Report X-2023061526

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: JOHNSTOWN
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found Leaking, there were no labels to indicate contents was a hazmat on the outer box. upon inspection of inner bucket was found to have a corrosive 8 label on it. all spilled liquid was cleaned up with gloves and following procedures. DescribePack: the inner bucket had a seal that leaked from the top of the bucket DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA and placed upright to prevent further leaking

item.title: Report X-2023061242
item.description:
Report X-2023061242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-18
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking after a fall on the load side. QA was called to clean up the spill. Package was placed into a damage tote with liner inside. DescribePack: Lid is slightly cracked about two centimeters, but leak likely came from vented cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with orientation arrows being followed.

item.title: Report X-2023061238
item.description:
Report X-2023061238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, placed into a damage tote, and taken to QA for inspection. Upon inspection contents were found having a broken lid. Outer container was found also having been slightly crushed at the same spot of the broken contents. DescribePack: Crack along cap, spanning from the upper lip to the lower edge. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a bag lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061178
item.description:
Report X-2023061178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: BUENA VISTA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded during Inbound sort. Facer PH noticed liquid stains on package and pulled for inspection. Leak discovered by QA. Package separated from others and OPM initiated emergency response measures. DescribePack: No outside damage to packaging except for stains from contents inside. Loose cap found on inner packaging, with spilled product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All released material kept inside package and plastic tote it was set inside for investigation. Tote used to contain any spills. PPE worn to protect employees during investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023060654
item.description:
Report E-2023060654

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1830 Professional Drain Opener - 1071 release from 5 boxes each containing (12) 32-ounce poly bottles. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 3' x 3' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All boxes of damaged product were placed into one 30-gallon and one 55-gallon poly drums. The impacted absorbents were collected and containerized into a separate 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023061105
item.description:
Report X-2023061105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-12
  • City: JOHNSTOWN
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in trailer leaking. The metal drum was placed up right in a red hazmat tote to stop the chemical from leaking out. DescribePack: Upon inspection found that the seal on the metal drum had a dent on the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was placed in a hazmat tote under the hazmat vent.
